title: Contributions to User Shopping and after Sale Experience
responsibility: I was responsible for improving the user interface design and interaction, and enhancing the overall user experience, while introducing design system practices to ensure long-term scalability and support ethical customer retention for the business.
description: CompetitionSuitShop was founded to offer bodybuilding competition suits at competitive prices globally.

content.subTitle: üìù Deconstructing Cart Abandonment with a Behavior-Driven Checkout Flow
content.subContent:
There was a significant increment in cart abandonment rates as reported by Google and Facebook trackers. After combining survey responses, direct feedback, and analytical reports, we identified three major causes behind these unexpected drop-offs.

  1. Uncertainty Around Delivery Timing
    Customers, particularly those ordering for upcoming competitions, were anxious about not receiving the product in time. The lack of a clear delivery date made them hesitant to place orders.
  2. Doubts About Product Fit & Measurements
    Shoppers questioned whether the product would fit them properly and were unsure how or when they‚Äôd provide their measurements. Many were unfamiliar with how to measure themselves accurately, causing hesitation in completing their purchase‚Äîeven though we actually collect measurements post-purchase through guided support.
  3. Repetitive Address Input
    A technical flaw in the flow forced new users to enter their shipping address twice, and existing users up to three times‚Äîintroducing unnecessary friction in the process.

To address these:

  • We began leveraging the user's competition date to reassure timely delivery and provided an ‚ÄúExpress Delivery‚Äù option to accommodate last-minute purchases when needed.
  • Measurement-related concerns were handled by clarifying the post-order measurement process at relevant points like the product page and checkout/cart interface‚Äîwhere users naturally expect this information.
  • Lastly, the address entry issue was addressed by streamlining account-level address management and aligning with PayPal‚Äôs billing/shipping auto-fill policies supported by most e-commerce platforms (explained in the slides below).

content.subTitle: Solving the Trust Deficit Caused by Competitive Pricing
content.subContent:
Our product is priced at nearly half or even a third of what top competitors in the industry charge‚Äîdespite offering equal or even superior quality, extensive customization options, and full made-to-order flexibility. However, this aggressive pricing strategy unintentionally created a trust deficit. Customers began to doubt the product‚Äôs authenticity and frequently questioned whether the items were second-hand or of inferior quality.

Additionally, confusion arose regarding whether the same product could be ordered for different competition categories, as each category followed distinct rules and featured different design styles.

To address these concerns, we implemented two key strategies:

  1. Clarifying the Product Nature
    We introduced messaging such as ‚ÄúMade to Order‚Äù, ‚ÄúMade for You‚Äù, and ‚ÄúBespoke Product‚Äù to emphasize that each item is crafted only after an order is placed‚Äîreinforcing the idea of uniqueness and quality.
  2. Enhancing Product Transparency
    Many product pages lacked detailed descriptions, a missed opportunity in e-commerce to build trust. We filled this gap by adding relatable, informative content that not only conveyed the premium quality of the products but also clarified their availability across different competition categories, including options for customization.

To further strengthen the perception of personalization, we designed a prominent ‚ÄúMade for You‚Äù badge placed directly on or around the product images. Since images typically receive the most user attention, this helped communicate key context more quickly and effectively than text alone.

content.subTitle: From Blog to Knowledge Base: Improving User-Led Discovery
content.subContent:
As the product gained traction in a niche market, it opened up the opportunity to compete with well-established brands ranking at the top of search results. A steady influx of new competitors‚Äîmany of whom are unfamiliar with the rules and dress codes due to the competitive space‚Äôs seclusion‚Äîrely heavily on coaches or brand-published blog content to navigate these requirements. This type of educational content has become one of the most organic and effective ways to build user trust and convert new customers.

To support the business‚Äôs long-term positioning in the market, I proposed transforming the existing blog content into a structured Knowledge Base system. Unlike standard blog articles, a knowledge base allows users to directly search and self-discover answers to their specific queries‚Äîsaving time and positioning the brand as the go-to authority for all competition-related information.

Over time, this initiative would not only reduce dependency on direct consultation (freeing up internal resources) but also boost word-of-mouth referrals‚Äîdriven by users‚Äô positive experiences with both the product quality and the reliable, self-service content platform. This would also allow the business to redirect attention toward scaling and streamlining other integrated operations.

  • Improve discoverability through searchable, topic-specific content
  • Reduce manual support by addressing repeat questions proactively
  • Position the brand as a trusted knowledge authority in the niche
  • Strengthened word-of-mouth growth through a better user experience
  • Free up operational bandwidth to focus on other business verticals

content.subTitle: ‚ú® The Paradox of Choice in 3D Product Customization
content.subContent:
We introduced a 3D customization feature for one of our product lines, allowing users near-complete freedom to design their own version‚Äîwith countless combinations and configuration possibilities. While this unlocked creativity, it also created a "paradox of choice": the more options users had, the more time they took to decide‚Äîand many ultimately dropped off without completing their purchase.

This problem was especially evident among mobile users, where limited screen space made it harder to present options effectively. Displaying all choices at once caused cognitive overload, leading to mid-way abandonment.

To solve this, my ongoing focus has been to optimize the customization flow based on real user behavior‚Äîstudying what patterns lead to successful purchases and what users respond to positively.

  • Identify user drop-off patterns tied to excessive choice and interface overload
  • Prioritize mobile UX, where limited screen space amplified friction
  • Iterate based on behavioral data, not assumptions
  • Work over defined success metric as reduced friction + increased conversion
  • Gradually redesign & improve customization flow to guide users, not overwhelm them

title: Introducing AI powered products related with existing OTA platform
responsibility: I was responsible for creating the brand identity to match the existing OTA platform, with a touch of AI. It was designed to work for people of all ages, handle different travel needs and edge cases, and also consider the token limit of ChatGPT when processing tourist requests.
description: HolidaySocho was founded to integrate AI into our existing online ticket aggregator platform, HolidayChalo, in the form of an AI-powered itinerary planner combined with travel packages, hotel bookings, and travel guides.

domain.desc: Catering Travel Planned embedded with Packages

content.subTitle: Introduction
content.subContent:
Every traveler dreams of discovering hidden gems and exploring places that truly resonate with their interests. But with endless recommendations available, finding what‚Äôs personally relevant can be overwhelming. This is where AI became a valuable tool to tap into traveler intent. 

 Before the launch of the GPT Store, we began experimenting with GPT as a wrapper to build an AI-powered itinerary planner. It generated personalized 7-day travel plans based on user interests, budgets, and even specific destinations. 

 To make the solution more viable as a business, we integrated it with our existing OTA services‚Äîallowing users not only to generate itineraries but also to book round-trip flights or get curated travel package deals from our partner platforms. Eventually, the core value was in the architecture itself, which became the key offering during its mid-mature stage of exploration and implementation.

content.subTitle: From Playful Interactions to Functional UI
content.subContent:
What started as an experimental idea soon evolved into a functional application used by many to explore trip ideas, receive personalized deals, and move from planning to booking seamlessly. The playful nature of early interactions‚Äîwhere users casually created travel plans‚Äîwas gradually shaped into a structured experience that supported real bookings for flights, stays, and complete itineraries. 

 As user engagement grew, the functionality matured. We continuously refined the UI to guide users toward what they were looking for, while also introducing features that aligned with our business objectives‚Äîlike showcasing relevant travel deals and promoting partner offerings. This balance of user delight and business impact defined the product‚Äôs growth from an AI experiment to a practical travel solution.

content.subTitle: Option Exploration Enhanced by Local Insights
content.subContent:
Although the service is now offline and much of the process wasn‚Äôt documented at the time, I‚Äôm in the process of recreating the experience to reflect how the functionality evolved as the platform grew. The goal is to help others feel how it worked during its active phase. 

 One of the key components was the card-based system for exploring destinations and related deals‚Äîdesigned to surface options in a visually intuitive way. We also gathered user feedback on the AI-generated outputs to understand how well the recommendations matched expectations. All interactions and search data were stored and monitored to make the experience more relevant, incorporating local context and refining future suggestions based on real usage.

title: Testing How We Can Convert a Website into a Mobile App ASAP
responsibility: Last year i saw Samsung promo using a web feature called PWA (Progressive Web App), which allows users to convert a website into a mobile app. The exploration is still ongoing, and I‚Äôm testing possible use cases for this portfolio website of mine, which will continue to be updated.
description: It is a demonstation of usage of PWA (Progressive Web App) which you can test on your smartphone as well by following steps provided below.

content.subTitle: How I First Experienced It Myself
content.subContent:
It began with a global marketing campaign designed to grab the attention of users across different mobile devices‚Äîoffering a unified experience through a clever web feature. The campaign invited users to explore Samsung‚Äôs latest innovations, and what stood out to me was how seamless it felt, even on non-Samsung devices like the iPhone. 

 Curious, I dug deeper and discovered that this was powered by PWA (Progressive Web App)‚Äîa technology that allows websites to function like native mobile apps. It felt like turning your entire phone into an app-like experience. This smart use of PWA technology to simulate a Samsung phone on any device sparked my interest and led me to further explore its potential and capabilities.

content.subTitle: ‚úÖ Experience It Yourself
content.subContent: Just like the Samsung demo experience, you can try out a PWA yourself by following the instructions in the video below. Test it on your phone and see how it works firsthand. This simple feature can open doors to personal branding‚Äîputting your presence right on people‚Äôs smartphones and giving them one-click access to your online assets.

content.subTitle: Why It Is Not Widely Adopted
content.subContent:
Even though implementing a PWA is relatively simple and websites can easily be converted into app-like experiences, the question remains‚Äîare companies truly adopting this for their customers? Is it widely accepted across industries? 

 If not, what‚Äôs holding it back from global adoption? Are there better alternatives, and if so, why are they preferred? 

 I‚Äôve addressed all these questions in the presentation below.

title: Reviving the MVP: How CompetitionSuitShop Going Back on Track
description:
CompetitionSuitShop was founded to offer bodybuilding competition suits at competitive prices globally. Its key edge lies in variety and a unique 3D configuration shopping experience. 

 In recent months, we noticed an unusual increase in bounce rate. Based on our findings, we took steps to address it, as discussed below.

content.subtitle: Problem Discovery
content.subcontent:
1. Abnormal increase in Bounce rate in-between certain flows and sections. 

 2. Decresing direct sales, doubt in product authenticity and not understanding some primary offerings by the brand. 

 3. Repetitive questions during consultation sessions caused unnecessary exhaustion over avoidable matters.

content.subtitle: Goals
content.subcontent:
1. Clearly communicate that all products are bespoke, customizable, and made to order. 

 2. Strategically minimize unnecessary consultation bookings. 

 3. Build longterm relationship with the athelets, recognition in the community and eventually more sales.

content.subtitle: Approach
content.subcontent:
Based on atheletes day-to-day conundrum, usability testing across product flows, cross-verifying / updating existing personas, and customer usage patterns before and after purchase, the detailed findings are discussed below. 

 Additionally, I proposed addons to existing business model that could be highly beneficial. However, due to the current code's lack of scalability, implementation by the development team remains challenging.

snapshots.imgTitle: Long-Term Customer Retention Strategy #1: Instant Incentives
snapshots.imgDesc: Potential Upselling, Reselling and Partnership Opportunities
snapshots.imgCont:
Product page is cluttered  with input fields asking for their Competition dates with their instagram id, for the purpose of getting to reach out on instagram, but at the same time making their decision time variable or in-decisive as questions arise? whats with soo many questions for some set of customers. 

 To tackle this, why not try making customer create their account or share contact details personally? When the goal is to build long-term relationships with the customer, might as well take actions such that the funnel stays active. 

 1. Quick gratification by providing them a sense of achievement by their actions, which is when they go to shopping cart, not only can they use "Coupon code" but also get "Free Accessories" as they use their personal account to order, also it won't incluse additional cost since everything mentioned is already free at the moment. 

 This will open few paths, such as Address Autofill, A/B testing with accounts, Reasoning drop-outs of particular customer, Target Marketing / Promotion, Persona Categorization to understand group of user behaviour, the list goes on and on. 

 2. Integrating various backend automation such as Abandon-cart remainder, Relevant Product recommendations, Seasonal trends from customer preferences from product browsing history. 

 Using data collected to provide other features like Product customization based on Color theory, building Precise Marketing Strategy and more.

snapshots.imgTitle: Long-Term Customer Retention Strategy #2: Referrals, Promotions and basic setup
snapshots.imgDesc: Potential Upselling, Reselling and Partnership Opportunities
snapshots.imgCont:
After the account is set, to further expand the network and gamify customer experience by providing Custom Products which is used a lot and is currently not sold and can tap larger market opportunity by not just being a part of the product which is used on the day of the competition, but also involved in their day-to-day life for what they rigorously prepare for. 

 An old school "Refer & Earn " quote as "Custom Feebies" letting customer unlock Special gift hampers like Bonuses / Discount & Vouchers / Accessories or Products which are also unique to them specifically. 

 It will be a small payoff for trading a custom accessory with 3X more sales and no waste incentives as it will only unlock if the refered people make their first purchase.

snapshots.imgTitle: Product Detail Page: Stating what's considered obvious, but isn't
snapshots.imgDesc: As a Ecommerce product page, it is essential to convey all the details related to the product that perfectly describes the quality and details of the product
snapshots.imgCont:
We lack product reviews because we're more like pinterest of product-patterns, which is why most of the customers spend time on out review page which signifies reviews with the product they purchased. 

 But for the Product Page as a substitue we needed things which could deligate the information, trust and engagement for all our products in order to conclude their decision on buying. 

 1. Instead of "Reviews", it's "Viewed by no. of people" to highlight new patterns visibility and people showing interest for a paticular pattern launched unknowingly. 

 2. Scalable product showcasing assets, including photoshoots, models, product-video and 3D/AR view mode. 

 3. Payment split either "One time" or "Installment" while highlighting payable amount accuratly. 

 4. Product details to covey that each prroduct style is available for all the competition suit category style and other important info. 

 5. Finally, banner to Consultation for amature or interested competitors and shoutout to instagram dms for quick assistance. 

 Although the page also includes additional inputs like "Competition Date" and asking for Instagram handle, eventually, it should not be there as sometimes, competitors themselves are not aware for which competition they would want to participate next.

snapshots.imgDesc: Beginners are currently most overwhelmed and spend more time doing research over every competition category
snapshots.imgCont:
The most recorded session hour is on our Blogs section and is the most valuable space where new competitors spend their time on. Using this to gain their confidence as we help them achieve their goal effeciently is best way to support the community. 

 Optimizing it such that a specific information can be pulled out of all the articles / blogs written so far, can be a good way to build trust and a reliable tool for all new / old atheletes.

snapshots.imgTitle: Reducing Cognitive Load from complex / unfamiliar User Experiences
snapshots.imgDesc: Less clutter increases chance of making decision quickly
snapshots.imgCont: Since 3D consfigurator for product purchase is new and in experimental phase for and the big e-commerce industry, we often find oursleves fine-tuning the process and here are some recent changes that i made according to recent user experiences and feedbacks: 1. Adjusting Color Contrast to improve visibility We introduced a tertiary brand color to enhance visibility while preserving the existing brand identity, ensuring accessibility for users with partial vision impairment 2. Shorten hand movement & White space balancing In UX terms, I implemented Fitts's Law, which emphasizes designing to minimize travel distance for common actions, resulting in reduced hand movement and a more intuitive ordering process. 3. Show more options only when needed Hick's Law states that the more option is presented, more time a person takes to make a decision. Thats why i introduces Progressive Disclosure as it reveals options only when user want to see what other options are available.

conclusion.conclusionDesc:
1. Reduced inquiries about product authenticity, avoidable inquiry rates, and bounce rate by 10~15%. 

 2.Increasing user engagement time spent across our website significantly.  

 3. Founding steps to improve user pre and post purchase experience to some extent.

The surge of AI tools with combination with our ongoing project called "Holiday Chalo" thats basically a OTA(Online Travel Aggregator), so we came up with a simple solution at first to provide customizable Travel Itinerary based on their admirable destination. 

 People when want to travel, they generally plant their trip and buy tickets and comoditions separately and manually. this is where we helped making their planning part easier with AI and with integrations with package providers, companies and partners to provide gread planned deals over itinerary recommended locations from beginning of the trip till the end.
Design sprint based on innovation and proven results, as people often get confused when the cycle of familiar interactive design is broken.

Quick access to packages, offers and promotions, blending with Gen Z way of discovering new places. 

 After brief research, I found that Gen Z's are more inclined to explore new things through recommended ads rather than actual AI features. It‚Äôs bizarre, but if it works, it works.

title: Convert your Website into a Mobile App using PWA (Progressive Web App), a web feature
description: Last year, in 2024, when Samsung released the S24, they also promoted a marketing campaign where people could experience Samsung on their personal phones, regardless of the brand. This idea stayed with me, and in 2025, I thought, 'Let‚Äôs give it a try and see how I can implement it, and what its capabilities and limitations are.'

content.desc: Samsung marketed new S24 features as "Try Galaxy on Your iPhone" literally. It felt like running Samsung OS on iPhone. This made me wanna explore just how they made it.

So what samsung did is allowing users to add a Progressive Web App which is basically a website, configured to be added to your phone homescreen, which behaves like an app and is capable of sending push notificatons and more. 
 
 I made my portfolio capable of doing the same, feel free to test it by following above instructions.

The technical aspects, boundaries, and limitations of PWA, along with when to use it and why it's not globally adopted, are addressed above. I will thoroughly test all its features to identify its limitations and will update it as I go.
